divs: sighting detailsat 8:15pm on dec. 31, 2011, my attention was cuaght to a southwestern window where i saw a huge ball of bright bluish-white light slowly arcing toward the earth to the west. it moved far too slowly to be a meteor\shooting star and was muuch too large. i ran to a western-facing window to see where it went but it had vanished. the moon was half-full and the skies were very clear. i've never seen anything like it. yes, it was new year's eve but i do not drink and this wasn't a flight of imagination.
trends: There have been no other sightings in San Acacio
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: a brilliant blusih-white ball of unwavering light in the southwest,about the size of the full moon, slowly falling in an arc to the west. Did not see it land
